cards.back: Piecewise-Linear: approximate nonlinear curves with straight line segments.

G = slope after breakpoint
E = breakpoint voltage
i = G(v - E) for v > E, else 0

R = slope after breakpoint
I0 = breakpoint current
v = R(i - I0) for i > I0, else 0
Current source + linear resistor + concave resistors in parallel.
Voltage source + linear resistor + convex resistors in series.

n breakpoints.
Each breakpoint separates two segments.

3 segments:
• Forward: v ≈ VF, i ≥ 0
• Reverse: i ≈ 0, -VZ < v < VF
• Breakdown: v ≈ -VZ, i < 0

Use linear analysis techniques in each region.
Simplifies computer simulation.

More segments = better accuracy.
More segments = more complexity.

Concave: voltage-controlled
Convex: current-controlled
